The term 'Sooners' has its roots in Oklahoma's history. During the Land Run of 1889, settlers who entered the Oklahoma Territory before the official start date were known as 'Sooners.' These individuals, often referred to as outlaws, were willing to take a risk by entering the territory early, ahead of the official land rush. The term 'Sooner' became synonymous with these early settlers who "sooned" their entry into the territory.

The University of Oklahoma adopted the nickname 'Sooners' in 1908 when the school's football team, which was previously known as the 'Oklahomans,' was renamed. The German-speaking Exiles, also known as the Exilliteratur, were a group of German-speaking writers, artists, and intellectuals who fled Nazi Germany between 1933 and 1945.
